result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Morales De Leon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan Morales De Leon in court.  Attorney Maryann Corea in court for Juan Morales De Leon.  Attorney Tyler Rubenzer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter: Hilda Shymanik
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel recently appointed and has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. Court grants request.
Case adjourned to Branch 13. 
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Court ordered no contact with JA
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney * for attorney *.

Defendant Juan Morales De Leon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal appeared by video for Juan Morales De Leon.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
